articles.author: Timothy Aeppel
articles.description: Jason Andringa’s company was part of the stampede of U.S. businesses that built factories in China.
articles.title: Mood swing: Global producers in US hunt for China alternatives

articles.author: Nick Carey, Paul Lienert
articles.description: A race is on to certify battery health and performance in used electric vehicles, with a clutch of startups scrambling to help buyers figure out how much a secondhand EV is really worth.
articles.title: The battery test race to work out what used EVs are really worth

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The yield on the benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury note rose above 5.0% on Monday, hitting the July 2007 milestone that it briefly attempted to scale last week.
articles.title: Ten-year U.S. Treasury yield hits 5%

articles.author: Richa Naidu, David Randall
articles.description: The growth in demand for appetite suppressing anti-obesity drugs like Novo Nordisk's (NOVOb.CO) Wegovy presents opportunities for food manufacturers and the market's initially downbeat reaction may be overdone, investors say.
articles.title: Analysis: Anti-obesity drugs can be boost for food makers, investors say

articles.author: Leigh Thomas
articles.description: Governments should open a new front in the international clampdown on tax evasion with a global minimum tax on billionaires, which could raise $250 billion annually, the EU Tax Observatory said on Monday.
articles.title: Global billionaire tax could yield $250 billion annually, study says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares in Taiwan's Foxconn (2317.TW), a major supplier of Apple's (AAPL.O) iPhones, dropped as much as 3% on Monday after a report the company is the subject of tax audits and land use probes in China just months ahead of a Taiwanese election.
articles.title: Foxconn shares drop after report of China tax audit, land use probe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese and Russian companies attending a regional conference in northeastern China signed a raft of cooperation deals on Monday in sectors ranging from manufacturing and logistics to e-commerce and agriculture, Chinese state media reported.
articles.title: In northeast China, Russian and Chinese firms ink deals from manufacturing to agriculture

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Israel's attacks concentrated on the Gaza Strip's centre and north, Palestinian media reported. A strike on a house near the Jabalia refugee camp, in northern Gaza, killed several Palestinians and wounded others, according to media reports.
articles.title: Israel strikes Gaza, Lebanon overnight; Netanyahu convenes generals

articles.author: Nicolás Misculin, Candelaria Grimberg, Anna-Catherine Brigida
articles.description: Massa had around 36% of the vote, ahead of Milei on just over 30%, while conservative Patricia Bullrich was behind on 23.7% with some 80% of the vote counted, a result that defied pre-election polls that had predicted a libertarian win.
articles.title: Argentina's Peronists seal election run-off with libertarian Milei
